Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a large red-brown pottery vessel, fabric black in section, interior slightly grooved and covered with small traces of a dark resinous deposit, exterior ribbed and with remains of twenty-one lines of Coptic text finely written in black ink, the sixth line being smudged, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.89-90)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87592) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87592)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 93 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
